title: PSA: Karma was the last 4800IP champion released.

replies.body: PSA: A lot has changed in 4 years. 4 years ago Riot didn't even think LoL would be alive in 2015.

> [{quoted}](name=itsHurricane,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=BhcY0LvX,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-01-10T07:56:34.747+0000)
>
> PSA: A lot has changed in 4 years. 4 years ago Riot didn't even think LoL would be alive in 2015.

That's not relevant to the fact it's been 4 years since a 4800IP champion was released.

> [{quoted}](name=Sackboy,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=BhcY0LvX,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-01-10T09:29:08.981+0000)
>
> That's not relevant to the fact it's been 4 years since a 4800IP champion was released.

It's actually directly related to that fact. 4 years ago, RIot released champions at 4800 IP, now the standard champion cost on release is 7800 IP.

Why is this a PSA?

How has this knowledge done me any service?

i don't understand the point? riot puts more work into champs now, so we have to play more to earn them....
makes sense to me
